alert.note: Alert for Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Columbus; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 2:10PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of New Hanover, Brunswick and southeastern Columbus Counties through 245 PM EST... At 208 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms extending from Northwest to Honey Island to near Exum to Little River Entrance. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Leland, Oak Island, Carolina Beach, Shallotte, Sunset Beach, Wrightsville Beach, Kure Beach, Holden Beach, Ocean Isle Beach, Caswell Beach, Bald Head Island, North Masonboro Island, Snows Cut, South Masonboro Island, Ocean Crest Pier, Yaupon Beach, Iredell, Boiling Spring Lakes and St. James. This includes the following highways... Interstate 140 between mile markers 15 and 16, and near mile marker 19. US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 1 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EST for southeastern North Carolina.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Columbus; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover
